function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Correlations between subjective and objective ieq data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Building occupants’ satisfaction and demands on ieq parameters are not studied under natural conditions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Indoor air and co2 concentration affect occupant satisfaction.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Differences in climate and hvac systems between northern and southern china affect thermal experiences and preferences.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Weak acceptance of cooler conditions in the northern group","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overcooling problem in buildings in northern china","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Narrow range of adaptation to thermal environment in winter for occupants in northern china","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in air quality satisfaction due to ventilation types in buildings in china","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Occupants may consider air quality unacceptable regardless of objective performance, leading to dissatisfaction and potential health risks.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lower acceptance for high co2 concentrations in building type a compared to building type b, leading to potential dissatisfaction and discomfort for occupants.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Comparison of different ieq monitoring tools and systems, which may result in the adoption of suboptimal systems and inadequate ieq management.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited sensor diversity in ibem may lead to incomplete monitoring of ieq parameters and potential health risks.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of sensor customization and flexibility in ibem limits its adaptability to different ieq monitoring scenarios.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited data flow and feedback interaction in ibem may hinder real-time adjustment of environmental parameters based on occupants’ needs and preferences.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of scientific and simplified deployment scheme for ibem","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Automatic linkage of ibem with environmental control system","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transformation of ibem deployment methodology from experience-based model to data-driven model","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contamination of the ibem hardware instrument with contagious pathogens or microbes","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate data security for the extensive ieq database","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate or misleading ieq data collection and transmission","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The spread of covid-19 due to physical interaction and lack of lockdown measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of occupant presence and actions on building energy use","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High energy use in unoccupied buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Energy performance gap in buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of research on actual energy performance of buildings","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unoccupied buildings may still consume energy, leading to wastage and increased costs","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher ventilation rates required for occupants’ safety may lead to increased energy use","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Close collaboration and physical interaction between municipal staff, researchers, and project partners may increase the risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases due to close interaction during communication between municipality and electric utility company","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of structured information leading to inefficiency in data analysis and management","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of cross-contamination and disease transmission through close contact with public infrastructure such as public lighting and traffic lights","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High energy consumption by public lighting and other systems","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential impact of social distancing measures on service energy consumption","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited impact of lockdown measures on energy use by systems","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of covid-19 due to unusual occupation of social assistance buildings and community centers during the pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased energy consumption in municipal buildings due to the shift to work-from-home policies during the lockdown.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pandemic outbreak of coronavirus","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Nearly unoccupied municipal buildings, elementary schools, and nursery schools","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The study involves analyzing energy consumption in buildings, which could be a potential indicator of building occupancy and human activity, both of which contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unexpected energy consumption in unoperated buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Minimal energy usage during lockdown","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate measurement of basal eui","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Violation of lockdown measures leading to increased building occupancy","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate reporting of building occupancy during the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of safety protocols for in-situ visits to buildings during the pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduced occupancy leading to continuous operation of systems","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Energy consumption variations due to lockdown","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Measured energy consumption of refrigerators","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Encouragement of telemedicine service instead of visiting clinics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Small health centers not attending covid-19 patients directly","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"}]}
